medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient developed right lower quadrant abdominal pain three days prior to presentation, which has worsened over 3.5 days. Symptoms include nausea, chills, lightheadedness, weakness, and decreased PO intake due to pain. Denies fevers, vomiting, diarrhea, BRBPR, melena, weight loss, and changes in urinary symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Gastritis, Kidney lesion left upper pole, right adrenal nodule, lichensclerosis, constipation, right breast fibroadenoma.
medical_history.family_history: Mother - high cholesterol, dementia. Father - HTN.
